div.dateline:
Rio de Janeiro
Feb. 3d 1882.
Prof. Dr. Hugo Schuchardt:
div.p:
On receipt of your favor of Dec 20, inquiring about modifications of the Portuguese language among the negroes of Brazil, I referred it at once to General Couto de Magalhães
Couto de Magalhães (1837-1898), brasil. Offizier, Politiker, Ethnologe, Folklorist und Autor; vgl. HSA 06773 ( Wolf, Nachlaß
, 46, gibt den Vornamen irrtümlich mit Conto an). one of our greatest travelers and our best authority on Indian languages. You will find his reply enclosed. HSA 06773, datiert auf den 29.1.1882.

In the absence of any work on the subject I have made inquiry for some romance or similar words in which negro characters are introduced but have so far been unable to learn of anything that would
serve your purpose. I remember to have seen in the newspapers occasional articles mostly of the nature of skits Parodie, Sketch. at various individuals in which an attempt was made to imitate negro phraseology. I fancy that this will be of no use to you but when I meet with them again I will send you some as example of how the negroes talk Portuguese.

If you meet Dr. Reiss
Johann Wilhelm Reiss (1838-1908), deutscher Forschungsreisender und Vulkanologe; keine Korrespondenz in HSA. please give him my kindest regards. I would like to have his address in order to send him some publications relating to Brazil,

postscript.p: [Auf der letzten freien Seite von Schuchardts Hand mehrere Namen, von denen er vermutlich Post erhalten oder an die er selber geschrieben hatte. Im HSA ist davon lediglich eine Korrespondenz mit em Letztgenannten Conto de Magalhães - HSA 06773 vom 29. 1. 1882 - nachgewiesen. 21 Dec 81. Dr. J. B. de Almeida Nogueira 20 Mai 82. H. Lämmert 26. Dec. 82. Gabriele de Dieser Teil ist unleserlich. –– 83 ? (Schreiner) 10 Mai 82. Conto de Magalhães]
